title: Section C
passagesOne: Questions 46 to 50 are based on the following passage.

questionsOne.Statement: What do most Americans think of women leaders according to a new Pew Research Center survey?

Options.text: They have to do more to distinguish themselves.
They have to strive harder to win their positions.
They are stronger than men in terms of willpower.
They are just as intelligent and innovative as men.

questionsOne.Statement: What do we learn from previous survey findings about women seeking leadership roles?

Options.text: They have unconquerable difficulties on their way to success.
They are lacking in confidence when competing with men.
Their failures may have something to do with family duties.
Relatively few are hindered in their career advancement.

questionsOne.Statement: What is the primary factor keeping women from taking top leadership positions according to the recent survey?

Options.text: Personality traits.
Gender bias.
Family responsibilities.
Lack of vacancies.

questionsOne.Statement: What does the passage say about corporate America in the near future?

Options.text: More and more women will sit in the boardroom.
Gender imbalance in leadership is likely to change.
The public is undecided about whether women will make good leaders.
People have opposing opinions as to whether it will have more women leaders.

questionsOne.Statement: What do most Americans expect to see soon on America’s political stage?

Options.text: A woman in the highest position of government.
More and more women actively engaged in politics.
A majority of women voting for a female president.
As many women in top government positions as men.

passagesTwo: Questions 51 to 55 are based on the following passage.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the global study tell us about people’s height in the last hundred years?

Options.text: There is a remarkable difference across continents.
There has been a marked increase in most countries.
The increase in people’s height has been quickening.
The increase in women’s height is bigger than in men’s.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does James Bentham say about genetics in the increase of people’s height?

Options.text: It counts less than generally thought.
It outweighs nutrition and healthcare.
It impacts more on an individual than on a population.
It plays a more significant role in females than in males.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does Elio Riboli say about taller people?

Options.text: They tend to live longer.
They enjoy an easier life.
They generally risk fewer fatal diseases.
They have greater expectations in life.

questionsTwo.Statement: What do we learn about 18-year-olds in Uganda and Niger?

Options.text: They grow up slower than their peers in other countries.
They are actually shorter than their earlier generations.
They find it hard to bring their potential into full play.
They have experienced many changes of government.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does James Bentham suggest we do?

Options.text: Watch closely the global trend in children’s development.
Make sure that our children grow up to their full height.
Try every means possible to improve our environment.
Ensure our children grow up in an ideal environment.
